title: Update vitepress dev server to support /app/* deep linking
description:
# VitePress Dev Server /app/* Deep Linking

## Context

The sample-app-lit is embedded in docs at `/app/*`. Deep linking (direct URL access to `/app/contacts/123`) needs to work in both production and development.

## Production (Cloudflare)

Cloudflare wrangler `_redirects` already handles `/app/*` deep linking:
- Requests to `/app/*` are redirected/rewritten to serve the SPA
- This enables pushState routing to work

## Development (VitePress/Vite)

VitePress dev server needs middleware to support the same behavior:
- [ ] Add Vite middleware to handle `/app/*` routes
- [ ] Rewrite requests to serve the SPA index.html
- [ ] Ensure client-side routing takes over after initial load

## Files to Update

- `docs/vitepress.config.ts` or `docs/vite.config.ts` - Add dev server middleware
close_reason: Added spaFallbackPlugin to docs/.vitepress/vite.config.ts that rewrites /app/* to /app.html, mirroring Cloudflare _redirects behavior

title: Prepare navigation-location-plugin package for publish
description:
# Publish ui-router-navigation-location-plugin to npm

## Status

**PR:** https://github.com/simshanith/lit-ui-router/pull/new/simshanith/nav-plugin-publish
**Branch:** `simshanith/nav-plugin-publish`

Implementation complete. Awaiting PR merge and workflow verification.

---

## Current State

- `lit-ui-router` is published via tag-triggered workflows
- `navigation-location-plugin` is `"private": true` and not set up for publishing
- Workflows are hardcoded to `lit-ui-router`

## Strategy Options

### A) Duplicate Workflows (Simple but repetitive)
Create separate workflow files for each package.

### B) Parameterized Workflows (Recommended)
Modify existing workflows to extract package name from tag pattern and handle multiple packages.

### C) Reusable Workflows
Create a reusable workflow called by package-specific triggers.

**Recommendation:** Option B - parameterized workflows. Less duplication, easier maintenance.

---

## Implementation Plan

### 1. Update `packages/navigation-location-plugin/package.json`

- Remove `"private": true`
- Set version to `0.1.0`
- Add `homepage`, `repository`, `files`, `keywords`
- Move `@uirouter/core` to peerDependencies
- Add `release-it` to devDependencies

### 2. Create `packages/navigation-location-plugin/.release-it.json`

Configure release-it with git tag pattern `${npm.name}@${version}`

### 3. Update `.github/workflows/publish-npm.yml`

- Add tag pattern for `ui-router-navigation-location-plugin@*`
- Extract package info from tag
- Parameterize build and pack steps

### 4. Update `.github/workflows/publish-gh.yml`

Tag both packages (or make configurable)

### 5. Update `.github/workflows/bump-version.yml`

Add package selection input for choosing which package to bump

---

## Files to Change

| File | Action |
|------|--------|
| `packages/navigation-location-plugin/package.json` | MODIFY - remove private, add metadata |
| `packages/navigation-location-plugin/.release-it.json` | CREATE |
| `.github/workflows/publish-npm.yml` | MODIFY - add tag pattern, parameterize |
| `.github/workflows/publish-gh.yml` | MODIFY - tag both packages |
| `.github/workflows/bump-version.yml` | MODIFY - add package input |

---

## Verification

1. Run `pnpm --filter ui-router-navigation-location-plugin build` - should succeed
2. Run `pnpm --filter ui-router-navigation-location-plugin pack` - should create .tgz
3. Manually trigger bump-version workflow with `ui-router-navigation-location-plugin`
4. Merge bump PR -> triggers tag -> triggers publish

---

## Decisions Made

- **Initial version:** `0.1.0` (experimental)
- **Peer dependencies:** Yes, `@uirouter/core` as peerDependency
- **Keywords:** `ui-router`, `navigation-api`, `location`, `plugin`, `spa`, `routing`

title: Integrate turbo remote cache in GitHub Actions
description:
## Overview
Wire up the deployed Cloudflare R2 remote cache to GitHub Actions CI/CD workflows.

**Target files**: 
- `.github/workflows/build-test.yml`
- `.github/workflows/publish-npm.yml`

## GitHub Actions Secrets/Variables Required
Only 3 values needed for cache consumption:
- `TURBO_TOKEN` - Authentication for remote cache (repository secret)
- `TURBO_API` - Worker endpoint URL, no trailing slash (repository variable)
- `TURBO_TEAM` - Team identifier, e.g., "team_lit-ui-router" (repository variable)

**Note**: CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN and CLOUDFLARE_ACCOUNT_ID are NOT needed for cache consumption.

## Progress
- [x] TURBO_API added as repository variable
- [x] TURBO_TEAM added as repository variable
- [x] TURBO_TOKEN added as repository secret
- [x] Workflow changes committed
- [x] PR #123 opened: https://github.com/simshanith/lit-ui-router/pull/123

## Verification (awaiting CI)
- [ ] CI builds show "Remote caching enabled" in turbo output
- [ ] Cache hits observed on subsequent CI runs

## Implementation
Add environment variables to CI workflows:
```yaml
- name: Build and Test
  run: pnpm run ci
  env:
    TURBO_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.TURBO_TOKEN }}
    TURBO_API: ${{ vars.TURBO_API }}
    TURBO_TEAM: ${{ vars.TURBO_TEAM }}
```

## Security Consideration
Current workflow only runs on first-party PRs (not forks) - this is correct for secrets access.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [x] Secrets configured in GitHub repository settings
- [x] build-test.yml updated with TURBO_* env vars
- [x] publish-npm.yml updated with TURBO_* env vars
- [ ] CI builds show "Remote caching enabled" in turbo output
- [ ] Cache hits observed on subsequent CI runs
- [x] Configuration documented

title: Set up Cloudflare R2 usage alerts
description:
## Overview
Configure billing usage alerts in Cloudflare dashboard to monitor R2 and Workers usage.

## Free Tier Limits (Monthly)

### R2 Storage
| Resource | Free Allowance |
|----------|----------------|
| Storage | 10 GB-month |
| Class A Operations | 1 million (uploads, deletes, lists) |
| Class B Operations | 10 million (reads) |
| Egress | Free (always) |

### Workers (turborepo-remote-cache)
| Resource | Free Allowance |
|----------|----------------|
| Requests | 100,000/day |
| CPU time | 10ms per invocation |

## Paid Tier (Beyond Free)
| Resource | Cost |
|----------|------|
| R2 Storage | $0.015/GB-month |
| R2 Class A | $4.50/million |
| R2 Class B | $0.36/million |
| Workers | $0.30/million requests |

## Recommended Alert Thresholds (80% of free tier)
| Metric | Threshold | Rationale |
|--------|-----------|-----------|
| R2 Storage | 8 GB | 80% of 10GB free |
| R2 Class A Ops | 800,000 | 80% of 1M free |
| R2 Class B Ops | 8,000,000 | 80% of 10M free |

## Setup Steps
1. Go to: https://dash.cloudflare.com/?to=/:account/notifications/create/billing_usage_alert
2. Select product (R2)
3. Set threshold value
4. Add email notification recipient
5. Repeat for each metric

**Note**: Alerts fire 1-2x per day - there may be delay before threshold triggers.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] R2 storage alert at 8GB
- [ ] R2 Class A ops alert at 800K
- [ ] R2 Class B ops alert at 8M
- [ ] Alert configuration documented

  "teamId": "team_lit-ui-router",

title: Investigate turbo remote cache options
description:
# Investigate Turbo Remote Cache Options

## Goal

Evaluate remote caching solutions for turbo to speed up CI/CD pipelines and local development across machines.

## Options to Investigate

### 1. Vercel Remote Cache (Official)
- Native integration with turbo
- Free tier available
- Requires Vercel account
- `npx turbo login` + `npx turbo link`

### 2. Cloudflare R2 + Custom Server
- Self-hosted option using Cloudflare R2 storage
- No egress fees (cost-effective)
- Requires custom cache server implementation
- Options: ducktors/turborepo-remote-cache, custom implementation

### 3. Self-Hosted Options
- AWS S3 + custom server
- Google Cloud Storage
- Azure Blob Storage
- Local network cache server

## Evaluation Criteria

- [ ] Cost (free tier, per-GB pricing)
- [ ] Setup complexity
- [ ] CI/CD integration (GitHub Actions)
- [ ] Security (team access, token management)
- [ ] Performance (latency, bandwidth)
- [ ] Maintenance burden

## References

- [Turbo Remote Caching Docs](https://turbo.build/repo/docs/core-concepts/remote-caching)
- [Cloudflare R2](https://developers.cloudflare.com/r2/)
- [ducktors/turborepo-remote-cache](https://github.com/ducktors/turborepo-remote-cache)
close_reason:
## Decision: Cloudflare R2 with turborepo-remote-cache-cloudflare

Selected AdiRishi/turborepo-remote-cache-cloudflare (v3.2.0) with R2 storage backend.

### Why R2
- Zero egress fees (vs S3/GCS)
- Generous free tier: 10GB storage, 1M Class A ops, 10M Class B ops/month
- Cloudflare Workers free tier: 100k requests/day
- Simple deployment (one-click or CLI)

### Implementation Plan
Created 3 new beads:
- lit-ui-router-kwc: Deploy turborepo-remote-cache-cloudflare to R2
- lit-ui-router-ax4: Integrate remote cache in GitHub Actions
- lit-ui-router-jp6: Set up R2 usage alerts (80% thresholds)

### Dependency Chain
Deploy (kwc) → CI/CD (ax4) → Turbo docs (cv6)
